New Records: Reynaldo López has the lowest ERA against the Phillies in three or more starts in a season by any pitcher since Jacob deGrom, who allowed no earned runs in 18 innings against them in 2018.
Key Match Events: Orlando Arcia hit two home runs, leading the Braves to a 7-2 win against the Phillies.
Reynaldo López worked six innings of one-run ball, allowing four hits and one walk with six strikeouts.
Bryce Harper doubled in the first and third innings but was stranded both times.
Matt Olson extended his streak to seven games with at least one extra-base hit.
Pre-Game Insights: Atlanta Braves manager Brian Snitker discussed Matt Olson’s resurgence and its impact on the team's offense.
Snitker expressed hope that the team's recent performance is a sign of more consistent scoring.
Post-Match Reflections: Reynaldo López commented on the added enthusiasm and fun when facing the Phillies, acknowledging their past playoff eliminations of the Braves.
Orlando Arcia expressed happiness about his recent improvement and the results of his hard work.
Brian Snitker praised his team's resilience and emphasized the importance of winning every game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves clinched the 13-game season series against the Phillies with the win.
Orlando Arcia's two-homer game was his first since 2019.
Sean Murphy hit a home run following Arcia's third-inning homer.
